summary: Best terminal for the Helix editor

description: I like it's configurability. It's pretty fast too.
summary: Been using wezterm for about a year and it's been great!

description: Disappointing. Could not figure out how you can paste text like you can in other terminals. Installed.... tried for a first time .... got frustrated.... deleted app. I do not see any additional value to use this app over the default Ubuntu terminal app. None.

I love this terminal because:
* It's compatible with ancient and new standards
* It can display bitmapped graphics inline using both SIXEL and modern protocols
* Window Panes!
* Scriptable via Lua!
* Keyboard-driven!
* Easily themable!

The cost: You actually have to read the manual. Google will find the manual for you easily. I promise.
summary: Wezterm is my favorite keyboard-driven power terminal

description:
WezTerm is easily the best terminal I've ever used, for a few reasons:
- Multiplexing
- GPU acceleration
- Ligatures
- Super customizable
- Sensible dependencies; not dependant on DE-specific libs
- RUST!

What can I say? There's no reason not to use WezTerm. Even if you're using a similar terminal like Alacritty or Kitty, you *need* to switch to WezTerm. 10/10.

Despite Wayland behavior is a bit wonky, it has the most sane defaults and very good configurability. I can safely recommend it if you are not that clueless to figure out how copy and paste works within a terminal (and has been for decades)

- blazingly fast
- ligatures
- multi platform
- the lead dev isn't a jerk

Easily the best terminal emulator i have ever used, super configuable, extremely powerful and customizable, can basically do anything you want it to.

It is moreso for power users tho, all the configuration is done in a lua text file (not too hard to do if you arent afraid of terminal), but its easily the most powerful and customizable terminal emulator i have ever used. Highly recommend.
summary: Amazing. Best I have ever used

description: And to all the people saying you can't paste, by default it's bound to middle click and it can be changed in the config.

Replacing gnome-terminal with Wez.

Quickly found a nice theme, Arthur (Gogh), and customized just for a tint of green, some transparency.

All cofigured in one config file that I can save for the ages to come.
modern terminal emulator with all the features you want
summary: modern terminal emulator with all the features you want

description:
- gpu rendering
- builtin multiplexer 
- ligatures
- bidi
- lua scripting
- even more stuff
Doesn't work on Wayland with Nvidia GPU.

The terminal user input area is fine, nothing special, nothing new that didn't already exist for 20+ years.
But my god the window boarder on Gnome is TERRIBLE. I mean really sucky. Just trying to resize the window is one of the worst user experiences I've had in Linux for years,.
